WorkServer and MasterServer communicate through the queue. There is not much connection between the two except for failover, so the custom worker theory is supported. However, it is recommended to read the implementation of WorkerServer, and MasterServer implementation, and then modify them after they understand it!

Ps: Still want to know what to consider based on what you want to customize the Worker?

---
WorkServer和MasterServer是通过queue进行通信的，二者之间除了故障转移外没有太多联系， 因此自定义worker理论是支持的。不过还是建议阅读完WorkerServer的实现，及MasterServer实现，对他们有了解后再做修改！

ps：还是想知道基于什么考虑想自定义Worker呢？

Thanks, reading.

There are several considerations:
1. We already have a lot of long-running type tasks. These tasks are basically plug-in. We didn't support orchestration before. Now I hope to do the orchestration.
2. We have a self-built scheduled task scheduling management service. At present, we only want to introduce a module that can do dependency management and task flow scheduling.
3. We have our own security and auditing considerations, so managing data sources, tracking task status, and the like are all done by ourselves or adapted to meet the requirements. Including alarms, we also need to take our unified alarm channel.

So the form we prefer is:
1. Self-built timing scheduling service is responsible for task flow triggering.
2. Dedicated services are responsible for dependency management and subtask triggering.
3. There is a client api abstracting communication with the server. The custom worker can have the function of the task in the task flow scheduling as long as the api is introduced.

Thanks again to EsSchduler for open source.

---
感谢，正在阅读。

有以下几个考虑：
1.我们已经有很多long-running类型的任务，这些任务也基本上是插件化的，之前不支持编排，现在希望能做编排。
2.我们有有自建的定时任务调度管理服务，目前只想引入一个能做依赖管理，任务流调度的模块。
3.我们有自己的安全和审计考虑，所以管理数据源，追踪任务状态之类的工作都是要自己实现的或者改造到符合要求。包括告警，我们也需要走我们统一的告警通道。

所以我们更希望的形式是：
1.自建的定时调度服务负责任务流触发。
2.专门的服务负责依赖管理和子任务触发。
3.有一个客户端api抽象了跟服务端的通信，自定义的worker只要引入这个api即可具备任务流调度中worker的功能。

再次感谢EsSchduler的开源。
https://github.com/analysys/EasyScheduler/releases   1.0.0  has  been published！
Thank you very much for your advice. It has been included in the development plan, temporarily close the issue. Please pay attention for our version  updates!

The servlet-api-2.5-6.1.14.jar and javax.servlet-3.0.0.v201112011016.jar packages in the lib package are deleted and can be successfully started.

---
将lib包下的servlet-api-2.5-6.1.14.jar 和 javax.servlet-3.0.0.v201112011016.jar这两个包删除掉，可以成功启动

[root@Redis-4 lib]# ls | grep "servlet*"
guice-servlet-3.0.jar
javax.servlet-3.0.0.v201112011016.jar
javax.servlet-api-3.1.0.jar
jetty-servlet-9.3.16.v20170120.jar
jetty-servlets-9.3.16.v20170120.jar
servlet-api-2.5-6.1.14.jar

note : delete javax.servlet-3.0.0.v201112011016.jar and servlet-api-2.5-6.1.14.jar resolve servlet conflicts



[root@Redis-4 lib]# ls | grep "protobuf"
grpc-protobuf-1.9.0.jar
grpc-protobuf-lite-1.9.0.jar
protobuf-java-2.5.0.jar
protobuf-java-3.5.1.jar
protobuf-java-util-3.5.1.jar

note : delete protobuf-java-2.5.0.jar resolve gRPC conflicts

Because both api-server and master-server depend on timing, I put the timing into the api-server. The correct way is to add timing to the common module, we will solve this problem in the next optimization.

> When accessing http://10**:8888, an error will automatically access the following URL, 404 error
> http://10***:8888/escheduler/users/get-user-info?_t=0.06944380999772859

>
> 2
> Background proxy port 12345 This is the port that is agreed to interact with the background or?
> Because when the eschedule background is installed, one-click startup does not involve the proxy port.

Check the error reported in the nginx log. If there is no permission to access the XX file, check whether the user in nginx.conf is correct.

> https://analysys.github.io/easyscheduler_docs_cn/%E5%89%8D%E7%AB%AF%E9%83%A8%E7%BD%B2%E6%96%87%E6%A1%A3.html#1%E3%80%81%E5%87%86%E5%A4%87%E5%B7%A5%E4%BD%9C

查看nginx日志中报的错，如果是没有权限访问XX文件，查看nginx.conf中user是否正确。

Just for u reference.

According to my understanding,there is no output define for a  task node of easyscheduler.

In some of our user cases,some task nodes need to use data produced by pre nodes.We mostly solve such cases by storing   data to a temp place.Other nodes only need to know where is the data  or what the pattern of the data.

In cases of microservice orchestration,we exactly need to pass data generated by some http apis to others.But I don't think  easyscheduler is good for such cases now.
